content.question: A random sample of 240 adults over the age of 40 found that 144 would use an online dating service. Another random sample of 234 adults age 40 and under showed that 131 would use an online dating service. Assuming all conditions are met, which of the following is the standard error for a 90 percent confidence interval to estimate the difference between the population proportions of adults within each age group who would use an online dating service?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator, the fraction 144 over 240 times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction 144 over 240, close parenthesis, and denominator 240, plus the fraction with numerator, the fraction 131 over 234 times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction 131 over 234, close parenthesis, and denominator 234, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>144</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>240</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>144</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>240</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>240</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>131</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>131</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.65 times, the square root of the fraction with numerator, the fraction 144 over 240 times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction144 over 240, close parenthesis, and denominator 240, plus the fraction with numerator, the fraction 131 over 234 times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction 131 over 234, close parenthesis, and denominator 234, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.65</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>144</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>240</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>144</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>240</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>240</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>131</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>131</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.96 times, the square root of the fraction with numerator, the fraction 144 over 240 times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction 144 over 240, close parenthesis, and denominator 240 end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator, the fraction 131 over 234 times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction 131 over 234, close parenthesis, and denominator 234, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.96</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>144</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>240</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>144</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>240</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>240</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>131</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>131</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator, the fraction 275 over 474 times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction 275 over 474, close parenthesis, and denominator 474" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>275</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>474</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>275</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>474</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>474</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.65 times, the square root of the fraction with numerator, the fraction 275 over 474 times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction 275 over 474, close parenthesis, and denominator 474" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.65</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>275</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>474</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>275</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>474</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>474</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator, the fraction 144 over 240 times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction 144 over 240, close parenthesis, and denominator 240, plus the fraction with numerator, the fraction 131 over 234 times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction 131 over 234, close parenthesis, and denominator 234, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>144</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>240</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>144</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>240</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>240</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>131</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>131</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>234</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.8: Confidence Intervals for the Difference of Two Proportions

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
